detaileddescription.para: the multiclass svm for fixed MKL weights
the lp solver wrapper
stores the last two mkl iteration weights
MKL termination threshold is set void set_mkl_epsilon(float64_t eps );
maximal number of MKL iterations is set by void set_max_num_mkliters(int32_t maxnum);

Class default Destructor
train Multiclass MKL classifier

parameterdescription.para: training data (parameter can be avoided if distance or kernel-based classifiers are used and distance/kernels are initialized with train data)

detaileddescription.para: get classifier type
returns MKL weights for the different kernels

parameterdescription.para: is output parameter, is set to zero if no weights have been computed or to the number of MKL weights which is equal to the number of kernels

simplesect.para: NULL if no weights have been computed or otherwise an array with the weights, caller has to delete[] the output by itself

detaileddescription.para: sets MKL termination threshold

parameterdescription.para: is the desired threshold value the termination criterion is the L2 norm between the current MKL weights and their counterpart from the previous iteration

detaileddescription.para: sets maximal number of MKL iterations

parameterdescription.para: is the desired maximal number of MKL iterations; when it is reached the MKL terminates irrespective of the MKL progress set it to a nonpositive value in order to turn it off

detaileddescription.para: Class Copy Constructor protected to avoid its usage
Class Assignment operator protected to avoid its usage
performs some sanity checks (on the provided kernel), inits the GLPK-based LP solver
inits the underlying Multiclass SVM
checks MKL for convergence

parameterdescription.para: is the number of currently done iterations

detaileddescription.para: adds a constraint to the LP used in MKL
computes the first svm-dependent part used for generating MKL constraints it is $ \sum_y b_y^2-\sum_i \sum_{ y | y \neq y_i} \alpha_{iy}(b_{y_i}-b_y-1) $
computes the second svm-dependent part used for generating MKL constraints

parameterdescription.para: is the index of the kernel for which to compute $ \|w \|^2 $

briefdescription.para: MKLMultiClass is a class for L1-norm multiclass MKL.

detaileddescription.para: It is based on the GMNPSVM Multiclass SVM. Its own parameters are the L2 norm weight change based MKL Its termination criterion set by void set_mkl_epsilon(float64_t eps ); and the maximal number of MKL iterations set by void set_max_num_mkliters(int32_t maxnum); It passes the regularization constants C1 and C2 to GMNPSVM.
